column1: Tukwila ( tuk-WIL-ə) is a suburban city in King County
column2: Washington
column4: located immediately to the south of Seattle. The population was 19

column1: The earliest people in Tukwila were the Duwamish
column2: who made their homes along the Black and Duwamish rivers. The name "Tukwila" is the Chinook Jargon word for "nut" or "hazelnut"
column3: referring to the hazelnut trees that grew in the area. The Duwamish lived in cedar longhouses
column6: and used the river for trade with neighboring peoples.

column2: the first white settler was Joseph Foster
column3: a Canadian pioneer who had traveled to the Pacific Northwest from Wisconsin. Foster would become known as the "Father of Tukwila" and represented King County in the Washington Territorial Assembly for 22 years. Today
column4: the site of Foster's home on the banks of the Duwamish River is part of Fort Dent Park
column5: which also served as a military base during the 1850s Indian Wars. Foster's name is memorialized in the Foster neighborhood of Tukwila
column6: where Foster High School is located.

column2: the small village grew into an agricultural center and remained a trading point in the upper Duwamish River Valley. Population began to grow and industry followed
column3: largely farm-oriented commerce. Early electric trains traveled along Interurban Avenue in Tukwila
column4: connecting to Renton and a line to Tacoma. The Interurban Railroad operated a commuter line from 1902 to 1928
column5: making it possible to travel from Seattle to Tacoma in less than an hour. The first macadam paved road in Washington state was in Tukwila and bears the name of this new method of street paving. One of the earliest paved military roads is located in the city.

column1: Tukwila was incorporated as a city in 1908. The city's first mayor was Joel Shomaker
column2: a newspaperman. Among the city's first council members was Del Adelphia

column1: Public schools in Tukwila are operated by the Tukwila School District
column2: which has five schools: Cascade View Elementary School
column6: and Foster High School. Foster High School is among the most racially diverse schools in the United States
column7: with students from 50 countries speaking 45 languages as of 2016. Also in the city is Raisbeck Aviation High School
column8: a public technical school operated by the Highline School District that opened in 2004.

column1: The Museum of Flight is an air and space museum located in the extreme northern part of Tukwila
column2: adjacent to Boeing Field. Tukwila is also home to the Rainier Symphony
column3: which conducts several performances each year at the Foster Performing Arts Center in Tukwila.In the 1990s and 2000s
